title: 114_hr665
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee, established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, advises on interagency coordination and collaboration to address tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee advises on interagency coordination, scientific representation in public health policy decisions, and priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. The Secretary appoints voting members who are not federal government officers or employees. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee shall include members from the scientific community, tick-borne disease voluntary organizations, health care providers, and patient representatives diagnosed with tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes members from the scientific community, tick-borne disease voluntary organizations, health care providers, and patient representatives diagnosed with tick-borne diseases. Members must represent a diversity of scientific perspectives relevant to the Committee's duties. Additionally, at least 2 representatives from States with high Lyme disease incidence or where it is an emerging threat must be included. The Secretary will also designate ex officio members. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes ex officio members from various Federal agencies designated by the Secretary, with the Assistant Secretary for Health serving as co-chairperson. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members elect a public co-chairperson for a 2-year term. Each member serves a 4-year term, vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment, and members can serve after their terms expire until successors take office. The Committee holds public meetings at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee holds meetings at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. The Committee members can request agenda items, and meetings are conducted as required by law. A report must be submitted annually to the Secretary, detailing the Committee's functions, members, activities, and recommendations. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee meets regularly and submits an annual report to the Secretary. Authorization of appropriations totaling $250,000 per fiscal year is allocated for the Committee's expenses, following the Federal Advisory Committee Act guidelines. Voting members cannot be permanent federal employees.
